title: Project-Based Learning (PBL) Course Based on Ultrasound Anatomy

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Program targeting medical equipment management and education professionals, aiming to cultivate practical skills combining ultrasound technology and anatomical knowledge. Participants engage in collaboration and practice using personal devices (BYOD)

learning_goals: Learners can accurately describe the 3D relationships of human anatomical structures (muscles, blood vessels, organs) by applying ultrasound image interpretation techniques
Through PBL team projects, learners can design ultrasound-based anatomy education scenarios and perform peer feedback according to evaluation criteria
Learners can demonstrate the ability to distinguish anatomical structures from pathological findings while operating ultrasound devices in real-time
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
